titles.title: To make it an unfair practice for any retailer to increase the price of certain consumer commodities once the retailer marks the price on any such consumer commodity, and to permit the Federal Trade Commission to order any such retailer to refund any amounts of money obtained by so increasing the price of such consumer commodity.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee Commerce, Trade, and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Amends the Federal Trade Commission Act to make it an unfair practice for any retailer with the authority to price a consumer commodity to increase the price once it is affixed to the commodity. Authorizes the Federal Trade Commission to order restitution of any money obtained by such an increase.
